testsuite.name: Validate GET API response
testsuite.system-out: Scenario: Validate fields in GET response # src/test/resources/features/get-api.feature:3 Given I send a GET request to "https://echo.free.beeceptor.com/sample-request?author=beeceptor" # steps.GetApiSteps.i_send_get_request(java.lang.String) { "method": "GET", "protocol": "https", "host": "echo.free.beeceptor.com", "path": "/sample-request?author=beeceptor", "ip": "223.185.131.221:12105", "headers": { "Host": "echo.free.beeceptor.com", "User-Agent": "Apache-HttpClient/4.5.13 (Java/11.0.27)", "Accept": "*/*", "Accept-Encoding": "gzip,deflate", "Content-Type": "application/json", "Via": "1.1 Caddy" }, "parsedQueryParams": { "author": "beeceptor" }, "rawBody": "[object Object]", "warnings": [ "Error in parsing JSON body. Please check the syntax. [\"[object Object]\" is not valid JSON]" ] } Then the response should contain fields "path", "ip", and "headers" # steps.GetApiSteps.validate_fields(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
